How did nanobodies A1 and E4 affect mito: They reversed the reduction in mitochondrial Ca2+ uptake caused by the E protein.
They further reduced mitochondrial Ca2+ uptake.
They had no impact on mitochondrial Ca2+ uptake.
They increased mitochondrial Ca2+ uptake beyond normal levels.
What effect did nanobodies A1 and E4 hav: They increased the open probability of the ion channels.
They completely blocked the ion channels.
They decreased the open probability of the ion channels.
They had no effect on the ion channel activity.
What is the primary role of the SARS-CoV: It forms pentameric ion channels that disrupt host cell ion homeostasis.
It directly binds to the host cell DNA to alter gene expression.
It acts as a primary receptor for viral entry into host cells.
It is responsible for the virus's immune evasion by mimicking host proteins.
What potential therapeutic application i: They could be used as direct antiviral drugs or as part of vaccine strategies.
They could be used to enhance the immune response to other viral proteins.
They could serve as a diagnostic tool for detecting SARS-CoV-2 infection.
They could be used to inhibit the replication of other unrelated viruses.
